title: Blue mould of tobacco
creator_contributor_role: Australian Commonwealth Film Unit, production company
subject_group: Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Botany - Australia
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plant diseases - Australia
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Natural history
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Plants - Disease and pest resistance

Agriculture, Business, Commerce & Industry/Fungi in agriculture
description: Recommended methods of controlling the Blue Mould disease which is a fungus living on tobacco plants. The disease is widespread in the Australian tobacco industry. Samples of infected plants; how it is spread; the use of benzol vapour as recommended by Research Officers; fertilizing the soil; irrigation by furrow and boom spray methods; helicopter and plane spraying; the work of the Research Laboratories which test suspected plants; and work towards breeding a blue mould resistant strain of tobacco.
